text: Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 - The Official Video Game is the official Olympic video game of the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. It was published by Sega. Its international launch is planned in 2020 for Xbox One, PC, PlayStation 4 and Nintendo Switch. It was released in Japan on July 24, 2019, initially one year before the Olympic games was due to take place. However due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the games were pushed back a further year, making the video game release exactly two years before the beginning of the 2020 Summer Olympics. It is the first traditional Olympics game since London 2012. Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 - The Official Video Game features 80 national teams and 18 events (33 are in the real olympics). Players can make their own players, have and play against fictional players in any mode, or licensed players by playing vs top athlete in training mode. ==Disciplines== The following events are in the game: {| |- |style="vertical-align:top;width:50%;"| *Athletics **Track ***100 m ***110 m hurdles ***4 × 100 m relay **Field ***Long jump ***Hammer throw *Aquatics **100 m freestyle swimming **200 m Individual Medley swimming |style="vertical-align:top;width:50%"| *Other **Baseball **Basketball **Beach volleyball **Boxing **Cycling, BMX racing **Football **Judo **Rugby sevens **Sport Climbing **Table tennis (singles and doubles) **Tennis (singles and doubles) |} ==VS. Licensed Players== Players are able to compete against licensed athletes in training mode for a limited time period. ==Reception== The Switch version received 80% from Digitally Downloaded, who said that "One of the areas that Tokyo 2020 immediately stands out is that it has a good range of different sports represented, and they all play differently." They went on to praise the presentation and the customisation, adding that "Sadly as a single player game it's a little lonely and limited."http://www.digitallydownloaded.net/2019/07/review-olympic-games- tokyo-2020.html?m=1 ==References== Category:2020 Summer Olympics Category:2019 video games Category:Association football video games Category:Baseball video games Category:Basketball video games Category:Beach volleyball video games Category:Boxing video games Category:Cycling video games Category:Judo video games Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games Category:Nintendo Switch games Category:Olympic video games Category:PlayStation 4 games Category:Sega video games Category:Sports video games set in Japan Category:Table tennis video games Category:Tennis video games Category:Video games developed in Japan Category:Video games set in 2021 Category:Volleyball video games Category:Water sports video games Category:Windows games Category:Xbox One games
